intro: Seseli sprengelii, commonly known as the Sprengel's seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and fern-like, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Seseli sprengelii is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
